page.title: 03ELVEDEN ESTATE TODAY 1
page.content: By the use of applied science and good planning over 11,000 acres are now cropped. The plan started by using a mixed farm system - cattle, sheep and pigs, and fodder to feed the same esp- ecially lucerne etc. The animals in turn fed off the various stubbles and fertilized as they fed. The programme has altered technically now with much mechanical investment and the cattle have gone, there are still 4 herds of pigs (5,000) and 1 flock of sheep(1,000),Suffolk/Border Leicester cross ewes.The latter are based at Icklingham but are moved round for feed.Crops include about 5,000 acres of cereals,3,000 sugar beet and 500 of root vegetables.Private forest accounts for 2,500 acres and rough grazing 1,500 acres.
